title: 2 Teen Girls Executed: HONOR KILLINGS?
itunes:title: 2 Teen Girls Executed: HONOR KILLINGS?
description:
The trial continues for Yaser Said, accused of killing his teen daughters. January 1, 2008, Said forced the girls to go with him to dinner, alone. This, after the girls and their mother had left the dad, hiding in Oklahoma following years of controlling and manipulation. The family returned to Texas after promises from the father. 

Police say Said drove them in a taxi cab to a hotel and shot his daughters. Amina was shot twice in the chest. Sarah, the younger daughter,  was shot 9 times.  Sarah managed to call 911 for help, naming her father as their killer. 

Joining Nancy Grace Today:

  • Troy Slaten - Los Angeles Criminal Defense Attorney, Slaten Lawyers, APC, Twitter @TroySlaten 
  • Dr. Angela Arnold - Psychiatrist, Atlanta GA, AngelaArnoldMD.com, Expert in the Treatment of Pregnant/Postpartum Women, Former Assistant Professor of Psychiatry, Obstetrics and Gynecology: Emory University, Former Medical Director of The Psychiatric Ob-Gyn Clinic at Grady Memorial Hospital
  • John Guard - Chief Deputy – Pitt County Sheriff’s Office (Greenville, NC), Specializes in Investigating Domestic Violence Cases,
  • Dr. Jeffrey M. Jentzen Professor of Forensic Pathology and Director of Autopsy and Forensic Services at the University of Michigan Medical School, former Medical Examiner in Milwaukee County, Wisconsin jmjentzen@gmail.com 

  • Kristy Mazurek - Emmy Award-winning Investigative Reporter 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
